 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!

 We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Product Manager to own and drive the roadmap and requirements for critical shared components within our Real Time Communication product suite. You will be the key link between engineering, product and product operation stakeholders, ensuring alignment and successful delivery of impactful solutions.

**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Technical Product Manager with a focus on backend systems, data platforms or API based products.
* Experience of defining and detailing requirements.
* Strong knowledge of data flows, billing, account management, and configuration tools in large-scale systems.
* Proven track record of managing complex, cross-functional projects with a focus on scaling and reliability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders.
* Technical background or experience with backend development, data infrastructure and analytics is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deep dive into the technical details and complexity.
* Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR) and AI.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role.  We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**Company Description**
 Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has nine offices worldwide.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Enterprise Account Manager will be responsible for generating new business sales revenue. This will be achieved through account planning, territory planning, working with Nexthink partners, using business development techniques and field-based sales activities.
   

  

**Your role**
* Achieve sales goals and targets for assigned territory on a quarterly and annual basis by:
* Developing a sales strategy in the territory with a target prospect list and a regional sales plan.
* Develop a regional strategy and plan to leverage Nexthink partners while supporting the closure of deals from Switzerland.
* Developing marketing plans with the marketing team to drive revenue growth and pipeline
* Taking a consultative approach with customers by understanding their existing challenges and future strategies to drive the Nexthink solution within the marketplace.
* Prospect qualification and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue growth
* Sales process management
* Ongoing account management to ensure customer satisfaction


**Qualifications**
* New business sales focus
* Previous sales experience gained within software or solution sales organizations
* Demonstrable track record of achieving sales goals
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* Fluent in English & Swedish
* Willingness to Travel


**Additional Information**
 We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.
   

  

 With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling
IT Sales Consultant/Sales Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Together, we are building a fintech that puts people at the center like no other. Driven by the desire to create something completely new. Supported and shaped by Bertelsmann, a strong foundation. Together, we make a difference—for all of us and for yourself.
   

  

**We are looking for an**
**IT Sales Consultant/Sales Engineer (m/f/d)**
**(permanent, full-time) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Münster, Amsterdam or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available**
 Join a growing team of dedicated, tech-savvy, and results-oriented employees. As a Sales Engineer/IT Sales Consultant (m/f/d), you will act as a technical expert and consultant for customers, business partners, and sales teams. You will work closely with our sales managers to assess, initiate, and secure the sales process for our enterprise clients.
   

  

 You will collaborate with our largest international B2B clients, leveraging your business knowledge, product expertise, and deep technical understanding to comprehend their business, customer-specific, and technical needs, and develop a corresponding solution based on our product components. You will work closely with our product team, actively contributing your knowledge to product development.
   

  

 This is your chance to shape the future of Riverty. You will influence opportunities that require collaboration, consensus, and creativity!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities and Tasks:**
* Represent technical and functional expertise in our products and support the development of business opportunities from qualification to deal closure and implementation/go-live
* Collaborate with the sales team in developing cross-product solutions to ensure a compelling message for sales
* Understand customers, buyers, and their procurement areas, and be able to create a convincing value proposition for specific customer situations, or understand and define technical requirements to solve their challenges
* Be familiar with every feature of our growing products and functions, and assist with all technical inquiries
* Monitor the status of change requests throughout the lifecycle, enforcing and redefining requirements when necessary
* Develop a cross-product standard for solution design and requirements management to support product owners and improve product alignment


**Qualifications:**
* Technical background (degree in IT, engineering, or a similar field)
* Deep understanding of the challenges large companies face when adopting a technology product
* At least 3 years of experience in IT sales or consulting for companies with a digital focus, preferably in the FinTech industry
* Experience leading cross-functional teams (e.g., product, legal, sales, etc.) to quickly find solutions that meet customer goals
* Analytical thinking and a structured approach to work
* Empathy and persuasiveness, able to hold business and technical conversations at multiple levels of the company
* Strong verbal and written communication skills English (C1-C2), German is a plus


 #EUR6
   

  

**Benefits:**
* Bei Riverty kannst du sein, wer du bist. Wir setzen uns dafür ein, eine inklusive Umgebung und eine wertschätzende Kultur zu schaffen, die durch unsere Mitarbeitenden-Netzwerke bereichert wird.
* Priorisiere deine Gesundheit mit unterstützten Sport- und Freizeitaktivitäten.
* Nutze unsere zahlreichen Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten! Entwickle deine Fähigkeiten mit Trainingsangeboten der Bertelsmann University, Sprachkursen oder Führungstrainings.
* Profitiere von unseren Rabatten auf Bertelsmann-Produkte und finanziellen Zusatzleistungen
* Mit unseren vielfältigen Arbeitsmodellen kannst du deine Arbeit nach deinen Wünschen gestalten. Profitiere von mobile Office, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Teilzeitmodellen.

title: Solution architect
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Ta chansen att vara med och omvandla ICAs digitala landskap hos våra butiker eller inom Supply Chain! Som Lösningsarkitekt driver du arbetet med att ta fram nya innovativa tekniska lösningar över flera funktioner och system, med fokus på butik eller supply chain. Om du gillar utveckling, att bygga nätverk och designa systemlösningar som gör verklig skillnad, då är detta rollen för dig!
   

  

**Om jobbet som lösningsarkitekt**
 Som lösningsarkitekt kommer du att utveckla tekniska lösningsarkitekturer för ICAs Transportsystem eller vidareutveckla butikernas affärssystem och driva end-to-end design. Du använder teknologier som SOAP, REST, EDI och microservices för att säkerställa att IT-landskapet och lösningarna är sammanhängande. Du arbetar strategiskt och i projekt, med fokus på att införa och vidareutveckla system som stödjer verksamhetens behov och utvecklar affären. Du kommer också att arbeta med cloud-lösningar, data governance, CI/CD och säkerhet för att säkerställa robusta och skalbara lösningar. Du arbetar nära produktägare och affärskunniga för att utveckla och tydliggöra E2E-designen. Rollen innebär också att arbeta i team med andra lösningsarkitekter för att lyfta arkitekturen till nya nivåer. På ICA är vi i ständig utveckling, så mycket av ditt arbete är framåtblickande för att möjliggöra nya lösningar och möta framtida behov.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi söker dig som är erfaren Lösningsarkitekt. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom Retail/dagligvaruhandeln och stöttat verksamhetsområden som exempelvis Supply Chain, Sortiment och inköp eller Försäljning/Marknad. Du har erfarenhet av arbete med lösningsarkitektur inom ett modernt IT-landskap och vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av både standardsystem och egenutvecklade system. Du bör ha ett helhetsperspektiv och kunna balansera kort- och långsiktiga mål. Självständighet och förmåga att driva arbete framåt är också viktiga egenskaper. Meriterande att ha arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder. Rollen kräver att du kan arbeta och göra dig förstådd på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Om du har frågor kring rollen kontakta rekryterande chefer, Emelie Sandén, tel: 073-338 11 29 (Wholesale Solutions, Manager Transport), alt. Emelie Hesse, tel. 070-329 93 74 (Retail Solutions, Manager Retail Cross Delivery). Om du har frågor kring tjänst, process eller urval kontakta Markus Öhman, rekryterare, tel. 076-695 62 04.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt dock ej senare än 15 december. Vi gör löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Identity & Access Management Consultant
job_function: Project Management, General Business, and Management
description:
**We Are**
 Accenture Security helps organizations prepare, protect, detect, respond, and recover along with all points of the security lifecycle. Cybersecurity challenges are different for every business in every industry. Leveraging our global resources and advanced technologies, we create integrated, turnkey solutions tailored to our client's needs across their entire value chain. Whether we’re defending against known cyberattacks, detecting and responding to the unknown, or running an entire security operations center, we will help companies build cyber resilience to grow with confidence. Our team of the security sector’s brightest people uses the coolest tech to out-hack the hackers and help clients build resilience from within. We blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security, and managed service solutions to rethink the entire security lifecycle.
   

  

 Do you have the deep functional and technical experience to help implement security solutions that align with our clients’ business objectives? Do you have the expertise to design and deliver solutions for establishing system user's credentials, and processes for applying those credentials to access enterprise systems and applications? If so, read on and apply. Accenture’s more than 2,000 security professionals deliver holistic and proactive security solutions in 47 countries, and we’d love to discuss our open Identity and Access Management (I&AM) Security role with you.
   

  

**You Are**
 A cyber security savant. You’ve got the skills and experience to keep data safe from black hat hackers or other threats, whether by coding a threat intrusion module or sharing your latest ideas with the team. Day-to-day, you’re all about solving security problems for clients and using your people skills to make sure everyone on your team is working well and happily.
   

  

 You are passionate about security, love what you do and have a genuine desire to outsmart the bad guys. You have the experience to analyze a clients’ security posture, anticipate security requirements and help find right-sized solutions based on industry leading practices. You have a proven track record working successfully in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. You’re a creative, analytical problem solver with above average documentation skills who can speak to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are eager to put your skills to use by helping us help our clients inject security at every level of their organization.
   

  

**The Work**
 The Identity and Access Management Security Specialist has the primary responsibility for the management and day-to-day operation of Fortune 500 Customer’s Identity Management systems and tools. This position will provide a successful level of service to business partners and end customers while adhering to web security and risk policies and standards throughout the enterprise.
   

  

  

- Install, integrate, configure, and deploy IAM solutions and systems to facilitate User Life-Cycle Management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, Single Sign-On, Federation, Privileged Account Management.

- Manage the complex PAM infrastructure and operations for the premier customer. Infrastructure includes multiple Servers for Enterprise password Vaults, DR Vault, Central policy Managers, Load balanced PVWAs, Application access Manager, Windows and Unix and On-demand Session managers, Privileged Threat Analytics, End Point Manager, SCIM servers, Enterprise backup solutions, for Safes and recordings backups

- Ensure an uninterrupted password change and reconciliation and session monitoring services for the windows, Unix and other Privileged administrators and business users’ activities

- Hands on experience in trouble shooting issues related to password rotation, account onboarding, monitoring, integrations with AD/ LDAP, SIEM Solutions and other integrations

- Develop and execute test cases and test plans for IAM solutions

- Responsible for Privileged User account administration of various Windows and UNIX accounts, Database and Network devices, Service accounts, DevOps and Scanning and Scripting Accounts

- Deep experience with Windows Operating Systems, UNIX/Linux and environments, IIS, SSO, Database and Application Servers, Authentication Products and ITSMs

- Integrating various platforms such as different LDAP providers, Windows Servers, UNIX Servers, Databases and networking Devices

- Creating and Managing Safes, Platforms and Owners, Managing Safes, recording backups

- Experience in installing or upgrading PAM solutions and connectors

- Perform health check monitoring on all severs to ensure consistent availability of system to end user

- Manage and evaluate the effectiveness of the enterprise's PAM Solutions and Services to ensure they provide the intended level of availability.

 Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.
   

  

**Here’s What You Need**
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)

- Minimum of 2 years of experience with managing cloud privileged Identities on various cloud platforms

- Experience in AD, lDAP, JDBC, SNOW connectors and end to end life cycle management

- Minimum 3 years of experience in at least one of the following IAM Vendor technologies or skills

- Saviynt: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud (EIC), Saviynt Third Party Access Governance, Saviynt Cloud Privileged Access Management, Saviynt Application Access Governance

- SailPoint: SailPoint IdentityIQ, SailPoint IdentityNow, SailPoint SecurityIQ

- CyberArk: CyberArk Alero for Vendor Access Management, PSM for Cloud, Conjur / DevOps Secrets management

- Ping: PingAccess ,PingID, PingFederate, PingDirectory, PingOne, PingAuthorize, PingIntellegence

**Bonus points if you have:**
- Exposure to I&AM practitioners and experts

- Prior work experience serving C-Level clients as a security consultant

- Industry-adopted security certifications (e.g. CISSP), as well as I&AM vendor or industry certification such as:

- Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM)

- SailPoint Certified Identity Professional Program Certifications

- ForgeRock Certified Access Management Specialist

- ForgeRock Certified Identity Management Specialist

- Prior experience in the deployment and implementation of custom applications

- Experience with any of the following security areas:

- Information risk, privacy, and strategy (i.e. security and privacy policies, or risk assessments, or security and privacy compliance);

- Application security (i.e. application security testing or security integrations with Systems Development Lifecycle (SDL)

- Infrastructure security; (i.e.- securing networks and servers or security monitoring)

- Data security or encryption

- Prior experience with any of the following:

- Provisioning Onboarding

- RBAC Authorization models

- SSO WAC technologies Enterprise SSO

- Federation

- Privilege User Management

- Directory Services Meta-Directory Virtual Directory

- Authentication Methods

- Entitlement Management

- OAUTH, OpenID Connect

- XACML

- JSON, REST, SOAP

- HTML5, IQuery, Node.js Location: Stockholm

**We look forward to learning more about you!** 
 Apply online, attach your CV and letter of application in English. If you have any questions, please contact responsible recruiter: karl.kego@accenture.com

title: Director & Lead Architect - Large Deal Solutions
Customer Success Manager
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in business-critical areas such as sustainability, GRC, and quality work. Unlike other compliance tools, we go a step further by moving organizations from reporting to action and effectively distributing responsibility internally.
 



 We’re looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work with clients in the public sector and manage a wide range of customer relationships.
 



 As a Customer Success Manager, you’ll focus on both our customers and our platform. You’ll be a main contact for small and large clients and take overall responsibility for their success. This role is all about combining platform knowledge with relationship building, so we’re looking for someone who enjoys working directly with our platform, staying close to customers, and driving growth. A data-driven approach will help you find ways to improve and create strategic solutions that bring real value to our clients.
 



  





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡** 



* An engaging work environment with people with a shared mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Work in a crucial and well-established area where we have a strong reputation. The public sector is a key focus for us, with a well-developed pipeline and substantial marketing support.
* Challenging, varied, and engaging work tasks with room and encouragement to be independent and innovative.
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Please look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office in one of Hötorgsskraporna in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 You’ll have a strategic impact by guiding clients from adoption to expansion—a key factor in our growth. Working closely with Project Managers and Sales Specialists, you’ll ensure clients fully utilize the platform, strengthening loyalty and opening doors for further sales.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Build long-term customer relationships based on trust and engagement, working with both senior decision-makers and operational teams.
* Ensure customers achieve their goals and get full value from our platform.
* Assist customers with platform adjustments and improvements.
* Advise customers, raising awareness and interest in our products.
* Develop deep product knowledge to become a trusted advisor for customers.
* Sales responsibility: Collaborate with Sales Specialists to proactively manage sales activities, meet revenue targets, and identify new opportunities within existing accounts.
* Manage personal responsibilities with an individual budget, including a clear sales and budget responsibility
* Handle negotiations, renewals, and public procurement agreements.
* Work with Sales Specialists to analyze product usage, identify growth opportunities, and optimize product utilization.



  





**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️** 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field, such as business administration or systems science.
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience, preferably as a Customer Success Manager.
* Strong interest in systems and digitization with experience in handling and learning new systems.
* Fluent in Swedish with excellent English skills.



  





**Bonus Qualifications:** 



* Experience working in the Public Sector or large organizations, understanding annual reporting, business planning, or quality processes.
* Understanding of complex sales methodologies.
* Prior involvement in public procurement and procurement processes.



  





**About You 👀** 




 To thrive in the role, we see that you are a relationship-builder with a genuine interest in customer-oriented work and smart digital solutions. You are self-motivated, proactive, and have a positive, attitude. You are fearless, ensuring tasks are completed and involving the necessary people along the way. You are curious and eager to learn, embracing new developments in the ever-evolving tech landscape. You value a positive team environment and the opportunity to be part of a growth journey. You are simply ready for your next adventure with Stratsys!
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you - Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Software Test Specialist, QA Lead
description:
Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär som testutvecklare och samtidigt ha en nyckelroll i att leda ett mindre team och driva testutvecklingen för att säkerställa främsta kvalitet? Vi söker en erfaren Testutvecklare för inbyggda system som trivs med att ta ansvar och arbeta nära innovativa produkter. I rollen som Software Test Specialist kommer du starta i ett kunduppdrag och sedan ha möjlighet att arbeta i olika projekt, både i kunduppdrag och i våra inhouse-projekt, där du får vara med och skapa framtidens tekniklösningar.

  

I ditt första kunduppdrag kommer du att:

* Leda QA-arbetet för ett mindre team och ta helhetsansvar för testprocessen, från planering till utförande och uppföljning.


* Driva och förbättra regressionstestning, samtidigt som du optimerar och automatiserar testprocesser för ökad effektivitet.


* Ansvara för kravhantering och säkerställa att systemutvecklingen möter både tekniska och funktionella krav


* Utvecklingen sker i C/C++ och Python.



**Din tekniska bakgrund**

* Master-/kandidatexamen inom data, elektro eller närliggande område.
* Testutvecklare med 5+ års arbetslivserfarenhet inom inbyggda system specifikt inom C/ C++, python och vana att arbeta i JIRA.
* Goda kunskaper i att arbeta med regressionstester, kravställning och testning
* God kommunikationsförmåga, flytande i svenska och engelska.

**Dina personliga egenskaper**


Att vara konsult kräver en flexibel och nyfiken grundinställning, ett självständigt arbetssätt och förmågan att bygga starka relationer med kunder och kollegor. Du är intresserad av de senaste teknikerna inom mjukvaruområdet och är motiverad att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.

**Together Tech för hållbar produktutveckling**


Vi ger möjligheter till att kunna utvecklas genom en variation av uppdrag inom olika branscher och områden, i uppdrag hos kund eller i något av våra spännande in-houseprojekt. Hos oss på Together Tech arbetar du tillsammans med andra ingenjörer som brinner för miljö och hållbarhet, alla med en vilja att skapa bestående lösningar med hjälp av teknik – eller som vi säger: Better World Tech!

**Din utveckling & vårt stöd**


Din utveckling och ditt välmående är viktigt för oss varpå vi erbjuder förmåner som stöttar dig och din karriär på bästa sätt. Vi värdesätter vikten av trygg anställning och fast lön, och är kollektivanslutna. För att främja din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr per år och även hälsoundersökning, bidrag till aktiviteter och friskvårdsrabatter.


Vi gillar att umgås med varandra i olika sociala aktiviteter, som passar alla! Alltifrån afterworks, sportaktiviteter och 5-kamp till företagskonferenser. Vi strävar efter att ge dig förutsättningar att växa genom olika uppdrag och projekt samt individuella utvecklingsplaner. Vi erbjuder även kurser inom hållbarhet och andra områden inom ramen för din roll och dina mål. Vi är stolta över att vara utsedda till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare 2024!  

  



Vill du veta mer om oss, besök gärna vår hemsida www.togethertech.com


För frågor kring den aktuella tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande ledare Peter Warlich, peter.warlich@togethertech.com
